messages.title: Bridget's pledges to you
messages.content: I love our area, I've lived in Islington for nearly 20 years. My Granddad even run a shop on City Road. I will always fight for local people - like when I led the campaign that saved the Essex Road Post Office.

messages.title: Labour MPs' shameful record
messages.content: Labour MPs voted to close our local Post Offices. Labour MPs voted against Lib Dem plans to get more police on our streets. Labour MPs voted for the Iraq war.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to the closure of local Post Offices.
Plans to get more police on our streets.
Would never vote for an illegal war, referencing opposition to the Iraq war.
Commitment to not claim a penny for housing, only for the cost of serving.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Elections in here are always a close race between the Lib Dems and Labour. The Conservatives and Green Party are out of the race and can't win here.

housing.content: I'll never claim a penny for my housing, only for the cost of serving you.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will be a hardworking local MP and will always put our area - and not party politics - first. Like you, I live here in Islington. I joined thousands of local people to march against the Iraq war - I will never vote for an illegal war.

politicalExperience.achievements: Led the campaign that saved the Essex Road Post Office.

contactInformation.address: Lydsey Seaborn and Russell Garrett, 2 Ockendon Mews, Ockendon Road, LONDON, N1 3JL

images.caption: A chart showing it's a two horse race with Lib Dem close to Labour and far ahead of Conservatives and Green Party

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet advocates tactical voting, emphasizing it's a two horse race between Lib Dems and Labour in the constituency.
